Package cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner.dataobject

Class Airport

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner.dataobject.Airport
public class Airport
extends java.lang.Object
The class which represent an Airport object and all the important available data about it.

    • getAptDatabase

      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Airport> getAptDatabase()
      Returns:
      Returns the airports database dictionary.
      See Also:
      aptDatabase

    • enterAirports

      private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> enterAirports​(java.lang.String initMsg)
      The method prompts the user to enter all the airports to be searched for and creates a list of provided strings which are separated by any non-letter character.
      Parameters:
      initMsg - The message to be printed prior to the prompt. If null, nothing is printed.
      Returns:
      Returns the non-null list of strings supposed to be airports' ICAO codes, municipalities or airports names, which will be searched for in the database.

    • searchAirports

      public static java.util.List<Airport> searchAirports​(java.util.List<Airport> airportsList, java.util.List<java.lang.String> predefinedApts, boolean repeatedSearch, boolean onlyICAO)
      This method takes a database of airports (either a complete database or its subset) and asks the user to enter all the airports he wishes to search for. Then iterates through the list and tries to match every input entry. The method also handles cases, when any or multiple airports match the input and asks user to correct/precise them.
      Parameters:
      airportsList - The list of the airports to be searched in. If null, then the stored database is retrieved and used in the method.
      predefinedApts - The fixed list of ICAO codes of the airports in the database. Used only to get the data about airport(s) for further processing by program.
      repeatedSearch - Indicates whether the method was relaunched because of an incorrect input.
      onlyICAO - If true, only the airports matching the ICAO code will be accepted.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of airports which match user's requests, or null if a database issue is detected.

    • showAirportsList

      private static int showAirportsList​(java.util.Collection<Airport> aptsToShow, java.lang.String fields, boolean autoProceed)
      Prints the list of specified fields in fields parameter of chosen airports specified in aptsToShow parameter.
      Parameters:
      aptsToShow - The list of all airports to be listed.
      fields - All the fields of the airports to be printed on stdout.
      autoProceed - Either directly lists all the specified fields of chosen airports or lets the user decide whether all the airports should be shown (used with large number of airports).
      Returns:
      The exit code of the action. Any non-zero code means that an issue has occurred.

    • setAirportsDatabase

      private static int setAirportsDatabase()
      Reads the file which contains the information about all available airports and creates the list of these airports which is a static field of Airport class.
      Returns:
      The exit code of the action. Any non-zero code means that an issue has occurred.
      See Also:
      aptDatabase
